Muhammad Asad.verse 9:112: The hypocrites, both men and women, are all of a kind: they enjoin the doing of what is wrong and forbid the doing of what is right, and withhold their hands [from doing good].
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:113: God has promised the hypocrites, both men and women – as well as the
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:114: deniers of the truth – the fire of hell, therein to abide: this shall be their allotted portion.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:117: Have, then, the stories of those who preceded them never come within the ken of these [hypocrites and deniers of the truth]? – [the stories] of Noah’s people, and of [the tribes of] ’ād and Thamūd, and of Abraham’s people, and of the folk of Madyan, and of the cities that were overthrown? To [all of] them their apostles had come with all evidence of the truth, [but they rejected them:] and so it was not God who wronged them [by His punishment], but it was they who wronged themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:118: AND [as for] the believers, both men and women – they are close unto one another: they
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:119: enjoin the doing of what is right and forbid the doing of what is wrong, and are constant in prayer, and render the purifying dues, and pay heed unto God and His Apostle.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:120: God has promised the believers, both men and women, gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide, and goodly dwellings in gardens of perpetual bliss: but God’s goodly acceptance is the greatest [bliss of all] – for this, this is the triumph supreme!
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:121: O PROPHET! Strive hard against the deniers of the truth and the hypocrites, and be adamant with them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:122: [The hypocrites] swear by God that they have said nothing ;
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:123: yet most certainly have they uttered a saying which amounts to a denial of the truth, and have
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:124: denied the truth after [having professed] their self-surrender to God: for they were aiming at something which was beyond their reach.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:125: His Apostle [to enrich them] out of His bounty! Hence, if they repent, it will be for their own good; but if they turn away, God will cause them to suffer grievous suffering in this world and in the life to come, and they will find no helper on earth, and none to give
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:127: And among them are such as vow unto God, "If indeed He grant us
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:128: out of His bounty, we shall most certainly spend in charity, and shall most certainly be among the righteous!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:129: But as soon as He has given them
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:130: out of His bounty, they cling to it niggardly, and turn away in their obstinacy [from all that they have vowed]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:131: whereupon He causes hypocrisy to take root in their hearts, [therein to remain] until the Day on which they shall meet Him – because they have failed to fulfil the vow which they had made unto God, and because they were wont to lie.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:132: Do they not know that God knows
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:133: their hidden thoughts and their secret confabulations, and that God knows fully all the things that are beyond the reach of human perception?
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:134: [It is these hypocrites] who find fault with such of the believers as give for the sake of God more than they are duty-bound to give, as well as with such as find nothing [to give] beyond [the meager fruits of] their toil, and who scoff at them .
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:135: God will cause their scoffing to rebound on themselves, and grievous suffering awaits them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:137: whether thou dost pray [unto God] that they be forgiven or dost not pray for them – [it will all be the same: for even] if thou wert to pray seventy times that they be forgiven, God will not forgive them, seeing that they are bent on denying God and His Apostle.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:139: who were left behind rejoiced in their staying away [from war] after [the departure of] God s Apostle, for they hated the thought of striving with their possessions and their lives in God’s cause; and they had
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:140: said [to the others], "Do not go forth to war in this heat!" Say: "The fire of hell is hotter by far!" Had they but grasped this truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:141: Let them, then, laugh a little – for they will weep a lot in return for what they have earned.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:142: Hence, [O Prophet,] if God brings thee again face to face with some of them, and then they ask thy leave to go forth [to war with thee], say: "Never shall you go forth with me, nor shall you fight an enemy together with me! Behold, you were well-pleased to stay at home on that first occasion: stay at home, then, with those who [are obliged to] remain behind!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:143: And never shalt thou pray over any of them that has died, and never shalt thou stand by his grave: for, behold, they were bent on denying God and His Apostle, and they died in this their iniquity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:144: And let not their worldly goods and [the happiness which they may derive from] their children excite thy admiration: God but wants to chastise them by these means in [the life of] this world, and [to cause] their souls to depart while they are
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:146: [They are indeed denying it:] for when they were called upon through revelation, "Believe in God, and strive hard [in His cause] together with His Apostle,"
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:147: such of them as were well able [to go to war] asked thee for exemption, saying, "Allow us to stay behind with those who remain at home!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:148: They were well-pleased to remain with those who were left behind – wherefor their hearts have been sealed, so that they cannot grasp the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:149: The Apostle, however, and all who share his faith strive hard [in God’s cause] with their possessions and their lives: and it is they whom the most excellent things await [in the life to come], and it is they, they who shall attain to a happy state!
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:150: God has readied for them gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide: and this is the triumph supreme!
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:151: AND THERE came [unto the Apostle] such of the bedouin as had some excuse to offer, [with the request] that they be granted exemption, whereas those who were bent on giving the lie to God and His Apostle
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:153: grievous suffering is bound to befall such of them as are bent on denying the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:155: no blame shall attach to the weak, nor to the sick, nor to those who have no means [to equip themselves], provided that they are sincere towards God and His Apostle: there is no cause to reproach the doers of good, for God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:156: Nor [shall blame attach] to those who, when they came unto thee [O Prophet, with the request] that thou provide them with mounts, were told by thee, "I cannot find anything whereon to mount you" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:157: they turned away, their eyes overflowing with tears out of sorrow that they had no means to spend [on their equipment].
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:158: Only they may rightly be reproached who asked thee for exemption even though they were fully able [to go to war].
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:161: be offering excuses to you when you return to them [from the campaign]!Say: "Do not offer

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:165: When you will have returned to them, [O believers,] they will swear to you by God, [repeating their excuses,] with a view to your letting them be.

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:187: Do they not know that it is God alone who can accept the repentance of His servants and is the
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:188: recipient of whatever is offered for His sake – and that God alone is an acceptor of repentance, a dispenser of grace?
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:189: And say [unto them, O Prophet]: "Act! Muhammad Asad.verse 9:190: And [there are yet] others – [people whose cases are] deferred until God wills to judge them: He will either chastise them or turn again unto them in His mercy – for God is all-knowing, wise.

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:192: house of worship in order to create mischief, and to promote apostasy and disunity among the believers, and to provide an outpost for all who from the outset have been warring against God and His Apostle.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:193: bears witness that they are lying.

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:195: Which, then, is the better: he who has founded his building on God-consciousness and [a desire for] His goodly acceptance – or he who has founded his building on the edge of a water-worn, crumbling river-bank, so that it [is bound to] tumble down with him into the fire of hell? Muhammad Asad.verse 9:197: the building which they have built will never cease to be a source of deep disquiet in their hearts until their hearts crumble to pieces.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:198: BEHOLD, God has bought of the believers their lives and their possessions, promising them paradise in return, [and so] they fight in God’s cause, and slay, and are slain: a promise which in truth He has willed upon Himself in [the words of] the Torah, and the Gospel, and the Qur’ān.
Muhammad Asad.verse 9:199: [It is a triumph of] those who turn [unto God] in repentance [whenever they have sinned], and who worship and praise ,

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:201: IT DOES NOT behove the Prophet and those who have attained to faith to pray that they who ascribed divinity to aught beside God be forgiven [by Him] – even though they happened to be

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:203: And Abraham’s prayer that his father be forgiven was but due to a promise which he had given the latter [in his lifetime]; but when it was made clear unto him that he had been God’s enemy,

Muhammad Asad.verse 9:206: And God would never – after having invited them to His guidance – condemn people for going astray ere He has made

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:1: Here is a disavowal (proclaimed) by Allah and His Messenger against the Mushriks (polytheists) with whom you have a treaty.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:2: So, move in the land freely for four months, and be aware that you can never frustrate Allah, and that Allah is going to disgrace the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:3: And here is an announcement, from Allah and His Messenger, to the people on the day of the greater Hajj, that Allah is free from (any commitment to) the Mushriks, and so is His Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:4: Except those of the Mushriks with whom you have a treaty, and they were not deficient (in fulfilling the treaty) with you, and did not back up any one against you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:5: So, when the sacred months expire, kill the Mushriks wherever you find them, and catch them and besiege them and sit in ambush for them everywhere.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:6: And if any one of the Mushriks seeks your protection, give him protection until he listens to the Word of Allah, then let him reach his place of safety.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:7: How can the Mushriks have a treaty with Allah and His Messenger? Except those with whom you made a treaty near Al-Masjid-ul-Harām .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:8: How (can they have a treaty) while if they overcome you, they will not observe any bond or treaty with you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:9: They have taken a paltry price for the verses of Allah, so they have prevented (people) from His path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:10: They do not observe any bond or treaty with a believer; and they are the transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:11: Then, if they repent and establish Salāh and pay Zakāh, they are your brothers in faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:12: And if they break their oaths after they have made a covenant, and speak evil of your Faith, then fight the leaders of infidelity,-since their oaths are nothing,-so that they may desist,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:13: Would you not fight a people who broke their oaths and conspired to expel the Messenger, and it was they who started (fighting) against you for the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has greater right that you fear Him, if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:14: Fight them, so that Allah should punish them at your hands and disgrace them, and help you win against them and bring relief to bosoms of the believing people,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:15: and remove the rage of their hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:16: Do you think that you will be left alone (without being tested), while Allah has not yet seen those of you who struggle in Jihād and never take anyone as their confidant other than Allah and His Messenger and the believers? Allah is fully aware of what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:17: It is not for the Mushriks to build up the mosques of Allah while they are witnesses of their own infidelity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:18: In fact, the mosques of Allah are built-up only by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and those who establish Salāh and pay Zakāh and who fear none but Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:19: Have you taken the serving of water to the pilgrims and the maintenance of Al-Masjid-ul-Harām as equal to (the acts) of one who believes in Allah and in the Last Day, and carries out Jihād in the way of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:20: Those who believed and emigrated and carried out Jihād in the way of Allah with their wealth and lives are greater in rank in the sight of Allah, and it is they who are the successful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:21: Their Lord gives them the happy news of Mercy from Him, and of (His) Pleasure, and of Gardens having an everlasting bliss for them,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:23: O you who believe, do not take your fathers and your brothers as your friends, if they prefer infidelity to Faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:24: Say, “If your fathers and your sons and your brothers and your spouses and your clan and the wealth you have earned and the trade you apprehend will recede and the homes you like are dearer to you than Allah and His Messenger and Jihād in His way, then, wait until Allah comes with His command.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:25: Allah has surely blessed you with His help on many battlefields, and on the day of Hunain, when you were proud of your great number, then it did not help you at all, and the earth was straitened for you despite all its vastness, then you turned back on your heels.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:26: Then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers, and sent down troops that you did not see, and punished those who disbelieved.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:27: Yet Allah relents, after that, to whomsoever He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:28: O you who believe, the Mushriks are impure indeed, so let them not approach Al-Masjid-ul-Harām after this year.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:29: Fight those People of the Book who do not believe in Allah, nor in the Last Day, and do not take as unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have declared as unlawful, and do not profess the Faith of Truth; (fight them) until they pay jizyah with their own hands while they are subdued.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:30: The Jews say, “ ‘Uzair (Ezra) is the Son of Allah” and the Christians say, “MasīH (the Christ) is the Son of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:31: They have taken their rabbis and their monks as gods beside Allah, and also (they have taken) MasīH the son of Maryam (as god).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:32: They wish to blow out the Light of Allah with their mouths, and Allah rejects everything short of making His light perfect, no matter how the disbelievers may hate it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:33: He is the One who has sent down His Messenger with guidance and the Faith of Truth, so that He makes it prevail over every faith, no matter how the Mushriks may hate it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:34: O you who believe, many of the rabbis and the monks do eat up the wealth of the people by false means and prevent (them) from the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:35: on the day it (the wealth) will be heated up in the fire of Jahannam, then their foreheads and their sides and their backs shall be branded with it: “This is what you had accumulated for yourselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:36: Surely, the number of months according to Allah is twelve (as written) in the Book of Allah on the day He created the heavens and the Earth, of which there are Four Sacred Months.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:38: O you who believe, what is wrong with you that when it is said to you, “Come out in the way of Allah,” you turn heavy (and cling) to the ground.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:39: If you do not march forth (in the way of Allah), He will chastise you with a painful punishment and will replace you with another nation, and you can do Him no harm at all.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:40: If you do not help him, (it makes no difference to the Prophet, because) Allah has already helped him when the disbelievers expelled him, and he was the second of the two, when they were in the cave, and he was saying to his companion, “Do not grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:41: March forth (in the way of Allah), no matter whether you are light or heavy, and carry out Jihād (struggle) in the way of Allah with your wealth and lives.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:42: Had it been a gain at hand or an average journey, they would have certainly followed you, but the distance seemed too far to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:43: (O Prophet,) Allah has forgiven you; why did you permit them (to stay in Madīnah) before the truthful ones could become distinct to you, and you could be sure of the liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:44: Those who believe in Allah and in the Last Day do not ask you to excuse them from Jihād with their wealth and lives.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:45: Only those people ask you to be excused who do not believe in Allah and in the Last Day and whose hearts are in doubt; so they are wavering in their doubt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:46: Had they wished to set out, they would have made some preparation for it, but Allah disliked their going forth, so He made them lag behind, and it was said to them, “Stay back with those who are staying back.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:47: And had they set out with you, they would have added nothing for you but trouble, and would have run around in your midst seeking mischief against you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:48: They sought mischief even earlier and tried to upset matters for you, until the Truth arrived and the will of Allah prevailed, though they disliked it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:49: And among them there is one who says, “Allow me (to stay behind) and do not expose me to an ordeal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:50: If some good comes to you, it annoys them, and if hardship befalls you, they say, “We had already taken care of our problem”, and they go their way delighted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:51: Say, “Nothing can ever reach us except what Allah has destined for us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:52: Say, “What you are expecting for us is nothing but one of the two good things (martyrdom or victory).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:53: Say, “Spend, willingly or unwillingly, it will never be accepted from you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:54: Nothing has prevented their spending from being accepted from them but that they have disbelieved in Allah and in His Messenger, and they do not come to the Salāh but lazily, and do not spend but without volition.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:55: So, their wealth and their children should not attract you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:56: They swear by Allah that they are from among you, whereas they are not from among you, but they are a people in fear.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:57: If they find a place of refuge or caves or any place to enter, they will turn towards it running (as) unbridled (horses).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:58: And among them there are those who find fault with you in (the distribution of) Sadaqāt (alms).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:59: Would that they were content with what Allah and His Messenger had given to them, and were to say, “Allah is sufficient for us; Allah and His Messenger will give us (more) out of His grace (when they so will).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:60: The Sadaqāt (prescribed alms) are (meant) only to be given to the poor, the needy, to those employed to collect them, to those whose hearts are to be won, in the cause of the slaves and those encumbered with debt, in the way of Allah and to a wayfarer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:61: And among them (the hypocrites) there are those who hurt the Prophet and say, “He is just an ear” (that is, he hears and believes everything).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:62: (O believers,) they swear by Allah before you, so that they may please you, whereas Allah, as well as His Messenger, has greater right that they should please Him, if they are (true) believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:63: Have they not come to know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger, definite for him is the fire of Jahannam (Hell) wherein he will remain forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:64: The hypocrites are afraid that a Sūrah (a chapter of the Holy Qur’ān) may be sent down about them, which tells them what lies in their hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:65: And if you ask them, they will say, “We were just chatting and having fun.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:67: The hypocrites, males and females, are all alike.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:68: Allah has promised the fire of Jahannam to the hypocrites, men and women, and to the disbelievers who shall live there forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:69: (You are) like those who were before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:70: Has there not reached them the news of those before them, the people of NūH and ‘Ād and Thamūd and the people of Ibrāhīm and the people of Madyan, and (the news) of the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear signs; so, Allah was not such as would wrong them, but they have been doing wrong to their own selves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:71: The believers, male and female, are friends to each other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:72: Allah has promised to the believers, male and female, gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they shall live forever, and good homes in gardens of eternity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:73: O Prophet, carry out Jihād (struggle) against the disbelievers and hypocrites, and be strict with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:74: They swear by Allah that they said nothing, while indeed, they had said the word of infidelity and had disbelieved after having accepted Islam, and had intended what they could not achieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:75: And among them there are those who made a pledge with Allah: “If He gives us (wealth) out of His grace, then, surely we shall give alms and shall be among the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:76: But when He gave them (wealth) out of His grace, they became stingy about it, and went back turning their faces away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:77: So Allah, in turn, put hypocrisy in their hearts till the day they shall meet Him, because they broke their promise with Allah, and because they have been telling lies.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:78: Do they not know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they whisper, and that Allah is well aware of all the Unseen?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:79: (Among the hypocrites, there are) those who taunt the believers who voluntarily give alms and have nothing but their hard earnings; still they mock at such people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:80: (It is all equal whether you) ask pardon for them or do not ask pardon for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:81: Those who were left behind were happy with their sitting back to the displeasure of the Messenger of Allah, and they disliked carrying out Jihād in the way of Allah with their wealth and lives, and they said, “Do not march in this hot weather.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:82: So, let them laugh a little, and weep a lot, this being a reward of what they used to earn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:83: Then, if Allah brings you back to a group of them and they seek your permission to march, say to them, “You shall never march with me ever after, and shall never fight an enemy in my company.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:84: And never offer a prayer on any one of them who dies, and do not stand by his grave.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:85: Their wealth and children should not attract you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:86: When a Sūrah is revealed (saying), “Believe in Allah and carry out Jihād in the company of His Messenger” the capable ones from them seek your permission and say, “Let us remain with those sitting back.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:87: They are happy to be with women who sit back, and their hearts are sealed; so they do not understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:88: But the Messenger and the believers in his company have carried out Jihād with their wealth and lives, and for them there are the good things, and they are the successful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:89: Allah has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow where they will live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:90: And the excuse-makers from the Bedouins came, so that they might be allowed (to stay behind), while those who were false to Allah and His Messengers (just) stayed behind (without seeking permission).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:91: There is no blame on the weak, or on the sick, or on those who have nothing to spend, if they are sincere to Allah and His Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:92: Nor (is there any blame) on those who, when they came to you so that you might provide them with a carrier (that they could ride for Jihād ) and you said (to them), “I find no carrier to give to you”, went back with their eyes flowing with tears in grief, because they had nothing to spend.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:93: Blame lies, in fact, on those who ask you permission despite being rich.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:94: They will make excuses to you when you return to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:95: They will swear by Allah before you when you will go back to them, so that you may ignore their misdeeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:96: They swear before you, so that you may be pleased with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:97: The Bedouins are often more strict in disbelief and hypocrisy, and are most likely to be ignorant of the limits of what Allah has sent down to His Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:98: And among the Bedouins there are those who take what they spend as a fine, and they look forward to the cycles of time to turn against you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:99: And among the Bedouins there are others who believe in Allah and in the Last Day and take what they spend as a source of nearness to Allah and of prayers from the Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:100: As for the first and foremost of the Emigrants (Muhājirīn) and the Supporters (AnSār) and those who followed them in goodness, Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Allah, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will live for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:101: And among those Bedouins who are around you there are hypocrites, and among the people of Madīnah as well.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:102: And there are others who admitted their sins while they had mixed a good deed with an evil one.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:103: Take Sadaqah (obligatory alms) out of their wealth through which you may cleanse and purify them, and pray for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:104: Have they not come to know that Allah is He who accepts repentance from His slaves and accepts Sadaqāt, and that Allah is Most-Relenting, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:105: Say, “Do (what you do); Allah will see your deed, as will the Messenger and the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:106: And there are others whose matter is deferred till the command of Allah (comes): either He would punish them or relent towards them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:107: And (there are) those who have built a mosque to cause harm (to Islam) and to promote infidelity and to create dissention among the believers and to provide a station for one who has been at war with Allah and His Messenger even before.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:108: Do not ever stand there (in prayer).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:109: Then tell me, which one is better, whether the one who has founded his building on fear of Allah and on search of His pleasure, or the one who has founded his building on the edge of an abyss that is about to collapse, then it did collapse with him into the fire of Jahannam ? Allah does not give guidance to the unjust people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:110: The building they had built shall always remain a source of unrest in their hearts, unless their hearts are cut into pieces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:111: Surely, Allah has bought their lives and their wealth from the believers, in exchange of (a promise) that Paradise shall be theirs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:112: (They are) those who repent, those who worship, those who praise (Allah), those who journey (in Allah’s way), those who bow in Rukū‘, those who prostrate in sajdah, those who bid the Fair and forbid the Unfair and those who preserve the limits prescribed by Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:113: It is not (permissible) for the Prophet and the believers to seek forgiveness for the Mushriks, even if they are kinsmen, after it became clear to them that they are the people of hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:114: As for the prayer of Ibrāhīm for the forgiveness of his father, it was only due to a promise he had made to him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:115: Allah is not such as He makes a people go astray after He has given them guidance, unless He explains to them what they should avoid.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:116: Surely, to Allah alone belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:117: Surely, Allah has relented towards the Prophet and the Emigrants (Muhajirīn) and the Supporters (the AnSār) who followed him in the hour of hardship after the hearts of a group of them were about to turn crooked, then He relented towards them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:118: And (He relented) towards the three whose matter was deferred until when the earth was straitened for them despite all its vastness, and even their own souls were straitened for them, and they realized that there is no refuge from Allah, except in Him, then He turned towards them, so that they may repent.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:119: O you who believe, fear Allah, and be in the company of the truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:120: It was not (permissible) for the people of Madīnah and for those around them of the Bedouins to stay behind abandoning the Messenger of Allah, nor to prefer their own lives to his life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:121: Whatever they spend, be it less or more, and whenever they cross a valley, is all written down for them, so that Allah may give them the best reward for what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:122: It is not (necessary) for all the believers to go forth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:123: O you who believe, fight those disbelievers who are near you, and let them find severity in you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:124: When a Sūrah is sent down, some of them (the hypocrites) say, “Whose faith from among you has been increased by this?” So far as the believers are concerned, it has certainly increased their faith, and they are quite happy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:125: As for those who have malady in their hearts, it adds further impurity to their (initial) impurity, and they die infidels.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:126: Do they not see that they are put to trial every year once or twice; still they neither repent, nor do they take lesson?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:127: And when a Sūrah is sent down, they look at each other (as if saying): “Is there someone watching you?” Then they turn away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:128: Surely, there has come to you, from your midst, a Messenger who feels it very hard on him if you face a hardship, who is very anxious for your welfare, and for the believers he is very kind, very merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 9:129: So, if they turn away, say (O Messenger,) “Enough for me is Allah.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:1: A declaration of immunity from God and His Messenger to the idolaters with whom you made a pact:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:2: 'Journey freely in the land for four months, and know that you cannot escape God, and that God degrades the disbelievers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:3: A proclamation from God and His Messenger to mankind on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage that God is free from obligation to the idolaters, and [so is] His Messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:4: Excepting those of the idolaters with whom you have made a pact, and who have not diminished [their commitment to] you in anyway, nor supported anyone against you; [as for these] fulfil your pact with them until the term.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:5: Then, when the sacred months have passed, slay the idolaters wherever you find them, and take them, and confine them, and lie in wait for them at every place of ambush.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:6: And if any one of the idolaters seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he might hear the words of God and afterward convey him to his place of security - that is because they are a people who do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:7: How can the idolaters have a pact with God and His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a pact at the Sacred Mosque? So long as they are true to you, be true to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:8: How, when, if they get the better of you, they do not respect any bond or treaty with regard to you, pleasing you with their tongues, while their hearts refuse, and most of them are wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:9: They have purchased with the signs of God a small price, and have barred
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:11: They respect neither bond [of kinship] nor treaty with regard to a believer; those, they are the transgressors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:12: Yet if they repent and establish prayer and pay the alms, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the signs for a people who know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:13: But if they break their oaths after
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:14: their pact and assail your religion, then fight the leaders of unbelief - verily they have no
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:15: oaths, so that they might desist.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:16: Will you not fight a people who broke their oaths and intended to expel the Messenger - initiating against you first? Are you afraid of them? God is more worthy of your fear if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:17: Fight them, and God will chastise them at your hands, and degrade them, and He will give you victory against them, and He will heal the breasts of a people who believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:18: And He will remove the rage in their hearts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:19: Or did you suppose that you would be left [in peace] when God does not yet know those of you who have struggled and have not taken, besides God and His Messenger and the believers, an intimate friend? And God is aware of what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:20: It is not for the idolaters to attend God's places of worship, bearing witness, against themselves, to unbelief; those, their works have failed, and in the Fire they shall abide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:21: Only he shall attend God's places of worship who believes in God and the Last Day, and observes prayer, and pays the alms, and fears none but God alone; it may be that those will be among the rightly guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:22: Do you reckon the giving of water to pilgrims and the attendance of the Sacred Mosque to be the same as he who believes in God and the Last Day and struggles in the way of God? They are not equal in God's sight; and God guides not the evildoing folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:23: Those who believe, and have emigrated, and have struggled in the way of God with their possessions and their lives are greater in degree with God; and those, they are the triumphant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:24: Their Lord gives them good tidings of mercy from Him and beatitude; for them shall be gardens wherein is enduring bliss,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:26: O you who believe, do not take your fathers and brothers for your friends, if they prefer disbelief over belief; whoever of you takes them for friends, such are the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:27: Say: 'If your fathers, and your sons, and your brothers, and your wives, and your clan, and the possessions which you have acquired, and merchandise for which you fear there may be no sale, and dwellings which you love, are dearer to you than God and His Messenger and struggling in His way, then wait until God brings about His command.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:28: God has already helped you on many fields, and on the day of Hunayn, when your vast numbers were pleasing to you; but it availed you nothing and the earth, for all its breadth it was straitened for you; then you turned back, retreating.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:29: Then God sent down His Spirit of Peace upon His Messenger and upon the believers; and He sent down legions you did not see, and chastised the disbelievers, and that is the requital of the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:30: Then afterwards God will relent to whom He will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:31: O you who believe, the idolaters are indeed unclean, so do not let them come near the Sacred Mosque after this year of theirs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:32: Fight those who do not believe in God, nor in the Last Day, and who do not forbid what God and His Messenger have forbidden, nor do they practise the religion of truth, from among of those who have been given the Scripture, until they pay the jizya tribute, readily being subdued.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:33: The Jews say: Ezra is the son of God; and the Christians say: The Messiah is the son of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:34: God assail them! How they are deviated!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:35: They have taken their rabbis and their monks as lords beside God and the Messiah, son of Mary, when they were not commanded, except to worship One God: there is no god except Him; glory be to Him above what they associate [with Him].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:36: They desire to extinguish God's light with their tongues; and God refuses but to perfect His light, even though the disbelievers be averse.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:37: He it is Who has sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, that He may manifest it over every religion, even though the disbelievers be averse.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:38: O you who believe, many of the rabbis and monks indeed consume people's goods by false means, and bar from the way of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:39: On the day when it shall be heated in the fire of Hell and therewith their foreheads and their sides and their backs shall be branded, 'This is what you hoarded up for yourselves: so taste now what you used to hoard!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:40: Verily the number of months with God is twelve months in the Book of God from the day that He created the heavens and the earth; four of them are sacred.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:41: Postponement [of the sacred month] is only an excess of unbelief, whereby those who disbelieve are led astray, one year they make it profane, and hallow it another, that they may make up the number which God has hallowed; and so they profane what God has hallowed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:42: O you who believe, what is wrong with you that, when it is said to you, 'Go forth in the way of God', you sink down heavily to the ground.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:43: If you do not go forth, He will chastise you with a painful chastisement, and He will substitute [you with] another folk other than you, and you will not hurt Him at all; for God has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:44: If you do not help him, [know that] God has already helped him, when the disbelievers drove him forth - the second of two; when the two were in the cave - when he said to his companion, 'Do not despair; verily God is with us'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:45: Go forth, light and heavy! Struggle in the way of God with your possessions and your lives: that is better for you, if only you knew.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:46: Had it been a near gain, and an easy journey, they would have followed you; but the distance was too great for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:47: 'Had we been able, we would have gone forth with you', destroying their souls, and God knows that they truly are liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:48: May God pardon you! Why do you give them leave, until it was clear to you which of them spoke the truth, and you knew those who were lying?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:49: Those who believe in God and the Last Day do not ask leave of you that they may struggle with their possessions and their lives; and God knows the pious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:50: They alone ask leave of you who do not believe in God and the Last Day, and whose hearts are doubtful, so in their doubt they waver.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:51: If they had desired to go forth, they would have made some preparation for it, but God was averse that they should be sent forth, so He slowed them down, and it was said: 'Stay back with those who stay back!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:52: Had they gone forth among you, they would only have caused you more trouble, and would have hurried to and fro among you, seeking to stir up sedition between you; and among you there are some who would listen to them; and God knows the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:53: Indeed, they sought to stir up sedition already before, and scrutinised your affairs until the truth, came, and God's command prevailed, they still being averse.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:54: And there are some of them who say, 'Grant me leave, and do not lead me into temptation'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:55: fallen into temptation! And surely Hell shall encompass the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:56: If good fortune befalls you, it vexes them; but if an affliction befalls you, they say, 'We took our precaution before; and they turn away, rejoicing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:57: Say, 'Nothing shall afflict us but that which God has decreed for us; He is our Protector; in God let the believers put their trust'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:58: Say: 'Are you waiting for anything for us but one of the two fair things? We are waiting in your case too, for God to afflict you with a chastisement from Him, or at our hands.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:59: Say: 'Expend willingly or unwillingly, it shall not be accepted from you; you are surely a wicked folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:60: And nothing prevents their expenditure from being accepted from them, but that they have disbelieved in God and His Messenger, and that they do not come to
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:61: prayer save as idlers, and that they do not expend without their being reluctant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:62: So do not let their wealth or their children please you: God only desires thereby to chastise them in the life of this world, and that their souls should depart while they are disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:63: And they swear by God that they truly are of you; but they are not of you; they are a folk who are afraid.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:64: If they could find a shelter, or some caverns, or any place to enter, they would turn and bolt away to it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:65: Some of them defame you concerning the voluntary almsgivings; if they are given a share of them, they are content, but if they are given none then they are enraged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:66: If only they had been content with what God and His Messenger have given them, and had said, 'Sufficient for us is God; God will give us from His bounty, and His Messenger [will also give us]; to God we are suppliants'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:67: The voluntary almsgivings are only for the poor and the needy, and those who work with them, and those whose hearts are to be reconciled, and for slaves, and for the debtors, for the way of God, and for the traveller - a duty imposed by God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:68: And of them are those who injure the Prophet, saying, 'He is only a listener!' Say: 'A listener to good for you, one who believes in God and has faith, in the believers, and who is a mercy to those of you who believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:69: They swear by God to you, so that they might please you, but God and His Messenger are more deserving that they should please them, if they are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:70: Do they not know that, whoever opposes God and His Messenger, for him shall be the fire of Hell to abide therein? That is the great abasement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:71: The hypocrites are cautious, lest a sūra should be revealed to them, informing them of what is in their [the hypocrites’] hearts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:72: And if you question them, assuredly they will say, ‘We were only engaging [in idle talk] and jesting’, Say: ‘Were you then mocking God, and His signs, and His Messenger?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:74: The hypocrites, both men and women, are of one another; they enjoin indecency, and forbid decency; and they withhold their hands shut; they have forgotten God, so He has forgotten them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:75: God has promised the hypocrites, both men and women, and the disbelievers, the fire of Hell, to abide therein: it will suffice them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:76: Like those before you, who were far mightier than you, and more abundant in wealth and children.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:77: Has not the tidings of those before them reached them — the folk of Noah, and ‘ād, and Thamūd, and the folk of Abraham, and the dwellers of Midian, and the Deviant ?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:78: Their messengers brought them clear proofs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:79: And the believers, both men and women, are allies of one another; they enjoin decency and forbid indecency; they observe prayer and pay the alms, and they obey God and His Messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:80: God has promised the believers, both men and women, Gardens underneath which rivers flow, to abide therein, and blessed dwellings in the Gardens of Eden, and beatitude from God is greater.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:81: O Prophet, struggle against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh with them; for their abode will be Hell, an evil journey's end!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:82: They swear by God that they said nothing; but they did indeed say the word of disbelief and did disbelieve after their submission [to God].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:83: And some of them have made a covenant with God :
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:84: 'If He gives us of His bounty, we will give voluntary alms and become of the righteous'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:85: Yet when He gave them of His bounty, they became niggardly with it and turned away in aversion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:86: So He made the consequence in their case hypocrisy in their hearts, until the day they meet Him, because they failed God in what they promised Him and because they lied.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:87: Did they not know that God knows their secret and their confidential talks, and that God is the Knower of the hidden things?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:88: Those who find fault with the believers who offer alms voluntarily, and such as find nothing [to offer] but their endeavours; and deride them - God
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:89: derides them, and theirs will be a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:90: Ask forgiveness for them, or do not ask forgiveness for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:91: Those who were left behind rejoiced at remaining behind the Messenger of God, and were averse to striving with their wealth and their lives in the way of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:92: But let them laugh a little and weep much as a requital for what they used to earn.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:93: So if God brings you back to a party of them, and they ask leave of you to go forth, say: 'You shall never more go forth with me, and you shall never fight with me against an enemy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:94: And never pray over any one of them when he is dead, nor stand over his grave; lo! they disbelieved in God and His Messenger, and died while they were wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:95: And let not their wealth and their children please you; God desires only to chastise them thereby in this world, and that their souls should depart while they are disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:96: And when a sūra is revealed, saying: ‘Believe in God and strive with His Messenger’, the affluent among them ask leave of you, saying, ‘Leave us to be with those who sit at home’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:97: They are content to be with those who stay behind and a seal has been set upon their hearts, so they do not understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:98: But the Messenger and those who believe with him strive with their wealth and their lives: for them are the good things; those, they are the successful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:99: God has prepared for them Gardens underneath which rivers flow, to abide therein: that is the supreme triumph.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:100: And those Bedouins who had an excuse, asking for leave.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:101: As for the weak, and the sick, and those who find nothing to expend, no blame falls upon them if they remain true to God and to His Messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:102: Nor against those who, when they came to you so that you might give them a mount - you having said to them, 'I cannot find [a mount] whereon to mount you' turned back, their eyes flowing with tears for sorrow that they could not find the means to expend.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:103: The way [of blame] is only against those who ask leave of you when they are rich.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:104: They will make excuses to you when you return to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:105: They will swear to you by God, when you turn back to them, so that you may leave them be.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:106: They will swear to you, that you may be satisfied with them; but if you are satisfied with them, God will surely not be satisfied with the wicked folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:107: The Bedouins are more intense in unbelief and hypocrisy, and are more likely not to know the bounds of what God has revealed to His Messenger; and God is Knower, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:108: And of the Bedouins there is he who takes what he expends as a penalty, and awaits for you
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:110: And of the Bedouins there is he who believes in God and the Last Day, and takes what he expends as
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:114: And the first to lead the way, of the Emigrants and the Helpers, and those who follow them by being virtuous, God will be pleased with them, and they will be pleased with Him; and He has prepared for them Gardens - with rivers flowing beneath them to abide therein forever: that is the supreme triumph.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:115: And among those around you of the Bedouins there are hypocrites, and among the townspeople of Medina, who are obstinate in hypocrisy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:116: And [there are] others, who have confessed their sins, they have mixed a righteous deed with another that was bad.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:117: Take of their wealth some alms, to purify them and to cleanse them thereby, and pray for them; truly your prayers are a comfort for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:118: Do they not know that God is He Who accepts repentance from His servants and takes the voluntary alms, and that God is He Who is the Relenting and the Merciful?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:119: And say: 'Act for God will surely see your actions, and [so will] His Messenger and the believers, and you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the visible, and He will tell you what you used to do'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:120: And [there are] others, who are deferred to God's command, whether He chastises them or relents to them; and God is Knower, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:121: And those who have chosen a mosque by way of harm, and disbelief, and to cause division among the believers, and as an outpost for those who waged war against God and His Messenger before, they will swear: 'We desired nothing but good'; and God bears witness that they are truly liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:123: Is he who founded his building upon fear of God and beatitude better, or he who founded his building upon the brink of a bank that is crumbling, so that it toppled with him into the fire of Hell? And God guides not the evildoing folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:124: The buildings which they have built will never cease to be a misgiving in their hearts unless their hearts are cut to pieces; and God is Knower, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:125: Indeed God has purchased from the believers their lives and their possessions, so that theirs will be [the reward of] Paradise: they shall fight in the way of God and they shall kill and be killed; that is a promise which is binding upon Him in the Torah and the Gospel and the Qur’ān; and who fulfils his covenant better than God? Rejoice then in this bargain of yours which you have made, for that is the supreme triumph.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:126: Those who repent, those who worship, those who give praise, those who fast, those who bow, those who prostrate themselves, those who enjoin decency and forbid to indecency, those who maintain God's bounds, and give good tidings to the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:127: It is not for the Prophet, and those who believe, to ask forgiveness for the idolaters, even though they be kinsmen, after it has become clear to them that they are inhabitants of the Hell-fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:128: Abraham's prayer for the forgiveness of his father was only because of a promise he had made to him; but when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he declared himself innocent of him; truly Abraham was soft of heart, forbearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:129: And God would never send a people astray after He had guided them, until He had made clear to them that which they should be wary of.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:130: Surely to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:131: God has truly relented to the Prophet and the Emigrants and the Helpers who followed him in the hour of hardship, after the hearts of a party of them had almost deviated, then He relented to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:132: And to the three who were left behind when the earth was straitened for them, for all its breadth, and their souls were straitened for them; until they thought that there is no refuge from God except in Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:133: to them that they might also turn [in repentance].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:134: O you who believe, fear God and be with those who are truthful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:135: It is not for the people of Medina and for the Bedouins [who dwell] around them to stay behind God's Messenger, and to prefer their lives to his life; that is because neither thirst nor toil nor hunger afflicts them in the way of God, nor tread they any tread that enrages the disbelievers, nor gain any gain from the enemy, but a righteous deed is therefore recorded for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:136: Nor expend they any sum, small or great, nor do they cross a valley, but it is recorded for them that God may reward them the best of what they used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:137: It is not for the believers to go forth altogether: why should not a party of every section of them go forth so that they may become learned in religion and that they may warn their folk when they return to them, so that they may beware?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:138: O you who believe, fight those of the disbelievers who are near to you, and let them find harshness in you, and know that God is with the pious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:139: And whenever a sūra is revealed, there are some of them who say: ‘Which of you has this increased in faith?’ As for those who believe, it has increased them in faith and they rejoice.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:140: But as for those in whose hearts is sickness, it only adds abomination to their abomination, and they die while they were disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:141: Do they not see that they are tested every year once or twice? Still they do not repent, nor do they remember.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:142: And whenever a sūra is revealed, they look at one another: ‘Will anyone see you?’ Then they turn away.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:143: Verily there has come to you a messenger from among yourselves for whom it is grievous that you should suffer; who is full of concern for you, to the believers full of pity, merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 9:144: So if they turn away, say: 'God suffices me.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:2: So, (O polytheists,) you may move about in the land (for) four months.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:3: (These Verses) are a (public) declaration from Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) for all mankind on the day of the Great Pilgrimage that Allah is absolved of all obligations to the polytheists, and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) too (is free from all obligations to them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:4: Except those idolaters with whom you made an agreement, who then did not show any latitude (in executing the treaty) and who did not support (or reinforce) anyone against you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:5: So when the sacred months have passed, then (as declared) kill the idolaters (who have re-initiated war) wherever you find them (during the war), capture them, imprison them and lie in wait for them at every place of ambush (to catch and besiege them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:6: And if any of the idolaters seeks asylum with you, provide him with protection until he listens to the Words of Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:7: (How) can there be a promise for the polytheists with Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) except for those with whom you have made a treaty near the Sacred Mosque (at al-Hudaybiya)? So as long as they remain true to (the treaty with) you, remain true to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:8: How (can one expect from them an honouring of the agreement)? They are in such a state that if they overpower you, they will have regard neither for any tie of kinship with you nor for any covenant.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:9: They gained a paltry price (in terms of worldly interests) for the Revelations of Allah and then started hindering (people) from His path (of the Din ).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:10: Indeed, it is extremely evil what they keep doing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:11: They have no regard for either a tie of kinship or a covenant in respect of a Muslim, and they are the people who have exceeded limits (in disobedience).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:12: (Even) then if they repent and establish Prayer and pay Zakat (the Alms-due), they are your brothers in Din (Religion).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:13: And if after making a promise (for peaceful bilateral relations), they break their oaths, (and restore the state of war,) and taunt you with sarcasm in your Din (Religion), then wage (defensive) war against (those) chieftains of disbelief (to eliminate any chance of mischief, violence and revolt).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:14: Will you not fight a people who broke their oaths (violating the peace treaty and restoring the state of war), and decided to banish the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) whilst the first time it is they who initiated war against you? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right that you should fear Him, provided you are believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:16: And He will remove the distress and fury in their hearts, and will accept repentance of whom He wills.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:17: Do you think that you will be spared (without passing through troubles and hardships), whilst Allah has not (yet) made distinctly known those amongst you who have fought in the way of Allah and (who) have not taken anyone as a confidant besides Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) and the believers? And Allah is Well Aware of the deeds that you do.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:18: It is not for the polytheists to maintain and frequent the mosques of Allah, whereas they themselves bear witness to their disbelief.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:19: Only he who believes in Allah and the Last Day and establishes Prayer and pays Zakat (the Alms-due) and who fears none but Allah can maintain and frequent the mosques of Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:20: Do you consider (the mere) serving of drinking water to the pilgrims and the management of populating and maintaining the Sacred Mosque (an act) equal to (the works of) a person who believes in Allah and the Last Day and fights in the cause of Allah? They cannot be equal in the sight of Allah, and Allah does not guide those who do injustice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:21: Those who have believed and have emigrated and have consistently toiled hard in the cause of Allah with their material and human resources enjoy a very high rank in the presence of Allah, and it is they who have achieved the ultimate goal.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:22: Their Lord gives them glad tidings of mercy from Him and of (His) pleasure and of (those) Gardens for them in which there are eternal delights;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:24: O believers! Do not take your fathers (and forefathers) and brothers for friends if they love disbelief more than belief.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:25: (O Esteemed Messenger!) Say: ‘If your fathers (and forefathers) and your sons (and daughters) and your brothers (and sisters) and your wives and your (other) kith and kin and the riches that you have earned (so hard) and the trade and business that you fear may decline and the homes you are fond of are dearer to you than Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) and struggling in His cause, then wait until Allah brings His command (of torment).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:26: Assuredly, Allah has helped you on a great many occasions, and (in particular) on the day of Hunayn, when the superiority of your (numerical strength) exhilarated you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:27: Allah then sent down His tranquillity (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:28: Then even after this, Allah accepts repentance of the one He wills (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:29: O believers! The polytheists are an embodiment of impurity, so let them not come closer to the Sacred Mosque after this year of theirs (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:30: (O Muslims!) Wage (also a defensive) war against those of the People of the Book who (infringed the peace treaty signed with you, and despite being in exile, provided full support to the disbelieving Meccan invaders who imposed the battle of al-Ahzab [the Confederates] on Medina, and have continued every possible conspiracy against you even now).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:31: of Islam) until they give in and surrender (to the command of Islam), and pay the capitation tax with their own hands after having been subdued.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:32: And the Jews said: ‘‘Uzayr (Ezra) is the son of Allah,’ and the Christians said: ‘The Messiah is the son of Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:33: They took their priests and monks for lords besides Allah and (also) the Messiah, the son of Maryam (Mary), whilst in truth they had not been given (any) command except to worship (only) the One God besides Whom there is no God.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:34: They desire to extinguish the Light of Allah by blowing through their mouths.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:35: Allah is He Who sent His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) with guidance and the Din (Religion) of truth to make him (the Messenger) dominant over every (other exponent of) Din (Religion), though much to the dislike of the polytheists.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:36: O believers! Indeed, the majority of the priests and monks (of the People of the Book) devour the wealth of people through unfair (means) and hinder from the path of Allah (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:37: And those who hoard silver and gold and do not spend it in the cause of Allah, warn them of a grievous torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:38: The Day when this (gold, silver and wealth) will be heated in the Fire of Hell, their foreheads, sides and backs will be branded with this (heated material, and it will be said to them:) ‘This is the same (wealth) that you treasured for (the benefit of) your souls.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:39: Indeed, the number of months with Allah has been (inscribed as) twelve in the Book of Allah (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:40: Postponing and deferring (the sacred months) is just an addition to disbelief.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:41: O believers! What is the matter with you that when you are asked to set out (to fight) in the way of Allah, you, weighing heavier, incline towards (the material and ignoble world of) the earth? Are you pleased with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? So, the property and belongings of the life of this world are worthless in (comparison with) the Hereafter (and carry) but little (value).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:42: If you do not move out (to fight for the promotion of peace and human dignity), He will afflict you with grievous torment and will replace you with another people and you will not be able to do Him any harm.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:43: If you do not help him (the Holy Messenger of Allah in the struggle for the dominance of Islam, then what!).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:44: Light or heavy, march forth (under all circumstances) and fight in the cause of Allah with your material and human resources.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:46: Allah safeguard (protect and exalt) you! Why did you permit them (not to participate in war), till those who were speaking the truth would be known to you and you would (also) know the liars?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:47: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day will not seek from you (this) permission that they should (not) fight with their possessions and lives.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:48: Only those who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day and whose hearts are in doubt will seek leave (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:49: If they had (really) resolved to go forth (for fighting), they would have procured (at least some) equipment for that.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:50: If they had come out (joining you), they would have added nothing to you except mischief and disorder and would have strived hard amongst you (to stir up disaffection and discord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:51: The truth is that they have been trying to cause subversion earlier too, and have been contriving schemes to upset your programmes until the truth came and the decree of Allah prevailed, though they disliked (it) downright.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:52: And amongst them is (also) he who says: ‘Accord me permission (to stay back home instead of going to fight) and put me not into trial.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:53: If some good (or some comfort) betides you, it grieves them, but if some adversity (or trouble) befalls you, then they say: ‘We had adopted (precaution in) our work in advance,’ and they turn away, rejoicing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:54: (O Beloved!) Say: ‘Never shall (anything) befall us but what Allah has decreed for us; He alone is our Protector.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:55: Say: ‘Are you simply waiting for one of the two good fortunes in our favour (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:56: Say: ‘Spend willingly or unwillingly, this (money) will not be accepted from you at all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:57: And there is nothing that stands in the way of acceptance of their spending (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:58: So neither their wealth nor their children should amaze you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:59: And (they are so cowardly that) they swear by Allah that they are from you whilst they are not from you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:60: (Their state of mind is such that) if they could find a place of refuge or a cave or a crevice in the earth, they would turn towards it running very fast (and would not stay with you even for a moment, but they are under compulsion right now so they show off their false loyalty).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:61: And some amongst them are those who pass sarcastic remarks against you in the matter of (the distribution of) alms.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:62: How good it would have been if they had felt pleased with what Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) had given them and said: ‘Sufficient for us is Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:63: Indeed, alms (Zakat) are meant for the poor and the indigent, and those who are deployed to collect charities and those in whose hearts the inculcation of love for Islam is aimed at.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:64: And amongst these (hypocrites) are also those who hurt (the Esteemed) Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) and say: ‘He is only an ear (believes everything he hears).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:65: O Muslims! They (the hypocrites) swear by Allah in your presence to keep you pleased, whereas Allah along with His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) has a greater right that they should please Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:66: Do they not know that he who opposes Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him), the Fire of Hell is (destined) for him wherein he will dwell forever? There is no humiliation greater than this.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:67: The hypocrites feel scared that a Sura (Chapter) will be sent down to the Muslims, and that will make them aware of those matters that are (hidden) in the hearts (of the hypocrites).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:68: If you ask them, they will certainly say: ‘We only used to talk (away the journey) and enjoy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:70: The hypocrites, men and women, are one from another (alike).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:71: Allah has promised the hypocrites, men and women, and the disbelievers, the Fire of Hell in which (they) will live forever.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:72: (O hypocrites!) You are like those who preceded you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 9:73: Has the news not reached them of those who were before them—the people of Nuh (Noah), ‘Ad and Thamud and the people of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the citizens of Madyan and the dwellers of the towns which were overturned? Their Messengers (too) came to them with clear signs (but they disobeyed).
